page.title: 04Wayside Stalls
page.content: Around Ravensden and Thurleigh lots of people who have flowers fruit and vegetables for sale leave them outside their gates. They put the things on a kind of table with a notice saying how much the things cost. They put money trays out so that people who buy things can leave their money in them. Most people are honest and pay for things but some people are not. One day a farmer who lives in Thurleigh put some eggs out to sell while he was at work. Somebody stole the eggs. I live in Ravensden and a man who lives near me sells apples, but he has never been robbed. These stalls are very useful to people because there are no shops nearby.
